result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario D Ivy Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges within nine months of today's date, 02/03/2017, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
*6/13/2016 Honorable Jeffrey A. Kremers-Credit amended to 28 days.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario D Ivy Jr

records.addlTxt: Fixed Error
Per Order signed on 6/13/2016: "JOC shall be amended to reflect a total of 28 days of sentence credit".
Signed and Filed Decision and Order Granting Request for Sentence Credit
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review. spc
Letter to defendant.
Defendant's pro se request for sentence credit.

Defendant Mario D Ivy in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are in court for sentencing.
Letters/correspondence received and filed.
  Sentencing proceeds.    Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by counsel and defendant.  
.
As to count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 6 months at the House of Correction with -0- days credit.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges within nine months of today's date, 02/03/2017, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.  Defendant REMANDED and taken into custody.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; defendant is to provide a DNA sample.  
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
cab

Defendant Mario D Ivy in court.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defendant appeared today for his sentencing but defense counsel did not appear because a bench warrant was issued on the last court date.
Court ordered the bench warrant withdrawn and reinstated the bail with all of the conditions previously set.
Case scheduled for a sentencing in Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

BRANCH 24 FOR BRANCH 36
Defendant Mario D Ivy not in court. Attorney Mogren unable to appear in court, but was informed of violation via telephone. Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE. Case in court due to violation. Due to Justice Point Violation and defendant failing to appear to address violation, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. Bail to remain on deposit. Case remains scheduled for Sentencing on 5/2/2016 at 8:30 am. Case adjourned to branch 36.

BRANCH 24 FOR BRANCH 36
Received and Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report; Positive Test.

Defendant Mario D Ivy in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Micha A. Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
State is ready to proceed to trial.  Defendant wants to change his plea.
As to count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to count 2:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
cab

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court, defendant Mario D Ivy not in court, in custody.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
State's Witness List received and filed.
Defense counsel waived the defendant's appearance for today's date.
Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 04/11/2016 at 08:30 a.m.

The court is not in session on 04/07/2016, the day after the trial was scheduled, therefore, defense counsel was contacted and a new court date was selected.
Case calendared for 04/11/2016 at 08:30 a.m. in Branch 36.

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court, defendant Mario D Ivy not in court, in custody.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Defense counsel waived the defendant's appearance for today's date.
Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer.  Case is adjourned for a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 36.  
  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01/19/2016

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CAB dob 1/13/85

Defendant Mario D Ivy in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Mario D Ivy in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
